radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked asymmetric enlargement and hypervascularity of the right testicle; hypoechoic region in the mediastinum testis most likely related to edema due to infection or inflammation; enlarged and hypervascular epididymis; associated complex hydrocele with septations and internal debris.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Further enlargement of the right testicle with a volume increase from approximately 19 ml to 33 ml; size of the hypoechoic region in the right mediastinum increased; multiple new nonspecific hypoechoic areas scattered throughout the remaining testicular parenchyma.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No findings in the genitalia or pelvis that were consistent with lymphoma or other cancers.
